intro: Tapirira guianensis subsp. guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan tapirira, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in tropical regions of South America. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical or ovate in shape. It produces small, clustered flowers with greenish-white petals, and its fruits are three-lobed capsules that release seeds when mature. This species is adapted to humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
